OrgREST Resource

Endpoints for retrieving and setting information about the organization.

GET /orgs/{org_id}

Gets information about the organization.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.    
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.    
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.    
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.    
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.    
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

    
org_id path The organization ID.   int
want_attachments_used_bytes query true if the org data should contain the attachments used bytes, false otherwise. This is deprecated and scheduled to be removed in v31. false boolean
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json FullOrgDTO (JSON) An object describing various aspects of the organization. For example, the returned object includes a user ID-to-userDTO map. Other API object properties use this map to see what user the objects reference.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/industries

An map indicating what industries the organization uses by default. The key portion of the map is the industry ID. The value portion is a boolean.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type
application/json object (JSON)

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/regulators

A map indicating what regulators the organization uses by default. The key portion of the map is the regulator ID. The value portion is a boolean indicating whether it's used by the organization. These regulators will be automatically selected in the create incident wizard.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type
application/json object (JSON)

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/regulators

Saves a map of the regulators that the organization uses by default. The key portion of the map is the regulator ID. The value portion is a boolean indicating whether it's used by the organization. These regulators will be automatically selected in the create incident wizard.

name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.

threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json object (JSON) An object describing the regulators that the organization uses.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found

500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json StatusDTO (JSON) A status object indicating success or failure.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/timeframes

Gets the timeframe to units/offset mapping for the organization. Many regulators are vague about how much time between when an incident is discovered and when various tasks are due. For example, the regulation may say that a task must be performed "Without unreasonable delay". Co3 has given that a day value of 45 days, however you can customize that by doing a PUT to the OrgREST timeframes endpoint.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type
application/json OrgTimeframesDTO (JSON)

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/timeframes

Saves the timeframe to units/offset mapping for the organization. Many regulators are vague about how much time between when an incident is discovered and when various tasks are due. For example, the regulation may say that a task must be performed "Without unreasonable delay". Co3 has given that a day value of 45 days, however you can customize that by doing a PUT to the OrgREST timeframes endpoint.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.

text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

media type data type

GET /orgs/{org_id}/data_types

A map that indicates which data types are collected for an organization. Data types that are listed here (with a true value) are shown as highlighted in the create incident wizard.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json object (JSON) A data type ID to boolean map.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/incident_types

Gets an incident type ID to incidentTypeDTO map. Incident types are specified in the incidentDTO (incident_type_ids property).

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json object (JSON) An incident type ID to incidentTypeDTO map.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/incident_types/{id}

Gets an individual incident type.

Incident types are specified in the incidentDTO (incident_type_ids property).

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
id path The ID of the incident type to retrieve. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json IncidentTypeDTO (JSON) Returns the incident type data.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/newsfeed

Retrieves the organization newsfeed.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints multivalued
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.   no
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.   no
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.   no
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.   no
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.   no
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

   no
org_id path The organization ID. int no
entry_type query The optional list of entry types of interest.   yes
limit query The optional number of entries to limit the query. int no
object_type query The optional list of object types of interest.   yes
since_date query The optional beginning time to start searching (number of milliseconds since Jan 1, 1970 GMT). long no
since_rev query The optional beginning revision number. int no
to_date query The optional end time (number of milliseconds since Jan 1, 1970 GMT). long no
to_rev query The optional end revision number. int no
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json NewsfeedEntryDTO (JSON) A list of newsfeed entry objects.

PUT /orgs/{org_id}

This method has been deprecated.

Saves information about the organization. To set these values, see PUT /orgs/{org_id}/settings

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json JustOrgDTO (JSON) The information to save.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json JustOrgDTO (JSON) Echos back the organization information.

media type data type description
application/json TwoFactorAuthDomainDTO (JSON) List of the two factor authentication domains that are available for use by this organization.

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/twofactorauth/{id}

Enable the specified two factor authentication domain for this organization. Once enabled, all users must successfully satisfy the 2nd factor authentication before they can access this organization.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

org_id path The organization ID. int

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/authldapgroup

Specify an LDAP group that is used to authorized LDAP users. Only LDAP users who belong to this group will have access to this organization.

DELETE /orgs/{org_id}/authldapgroup

Remove an LDAP authorizing group. Use this option to prevent any LDAP user from having access to this organization.
